main event: A bright, oval-shaped object was observed in Elkhart Lake, Wisconsin, on the night of August 11, 1960, moving at a high rate of speed before disappearing.
interesting points: The object was described as glowing from within and red-orange in color., The sighting lasted for approximately 20 minutes., There were two confirmed witnesses to this event., The observers believed the object was not a conventional aircraft., Reports indicate that the sighting may have been caused by the navigation light of a small plane.
witness description: two individuals observing from a vacation spot
